lines.text: It's the system. Two years old, you stand up. Seventy years later, you fall down again.
Who needs sight; we have vision.
Everybody else got a two wheeler when they turned ten, I got a paperback copy of Das Kapital.
One more word, and I'll make a citizen's arrest for crimes against the language.
Truth is I hate running. Being immortal takes too much time.
Lord, I asked for help, and you send me a weird Commie blind man.
I was one person for the first eighty years. Why not a hundred for the next five?
Lies, not lies - alternatives. Sometimes the truth doesn't quite fit.
All right, let's see now. We got three possibilities. We got, uh, exile in Great Neck, Devil's Island and kindergarten. All rejected. And now if you'll excuse me, I'm a very busy person.
You made it up. You made it all up.
Of course.
Conned your own kid.
Go back to sleep.
That's a sin!
mine.
You're not a nice guy. I'm ashamed I even sung a song with you.
You don't understand. Nursing homes were dancing in her head. Desperate measures were required.
Hey, Rappaport! I haven't seen you in ages. How have you been?
I'm not Rappaport.
Rappaport, what happened to you? You used to be a short fat guy, and now you're a tall skinny guy.
I'm not Rappaport.
Rappaport, you used to be a young guy with a beard, and now you're an old guy with a mustache.
I'm not Rappaport.
Rappaport, how has this happened? You used to be a cowardly little white guy, and now you're a big imposing black guy.
I'm not Rappaport.
And you changed your name, too!
